introduction.p:
Many of the problems in this book have been used in multiple sources. If a problem was set in a know competition, it cited in the problem statement. For most other problems, no effort has been made to identify when it was first posed, but most of the problems in this book among the following list of sources. An additional source of problems are the problem sections of the Mathematical Association of America journals:
The American Mathematical Monthley
Mathematics Magazine
The College Mathematics Journal
For problems that were posed in these journals, the source is cited with the problems.

Problems from past exams are used in several cases. A list of the competitions from which I've drawn examples follows.
MAA Northeast Section Collegiate Math Competition
Virginia Tech Regional Mathematics Contest
William Lowell Putnam Mathematics Competition (naturally!)
